name: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. ANONYMOUS ATTORNEY, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Office of Disciplinary Counsel v. Anonymous Attorney

judges: Justice NIGRO files a dissenting statement.
parties: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. ANONYMOUS ATTORNEY, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 27th day of September, 2000, it is ordered that the charges docketed at No. 22 DB 1998 be dismissed.
Justice NIGRO files a dissenting statement.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

opinions.text:
NIGRO, Justice,
Dissenting.
I dissent because I find that there was clear and sufficient evidence to establish that Respondent committed numerous violations of Rule of Professional Conduct 1.1.
opinions.author: NIGRO, Justice,

casebody.head_matter:
759 A.2d 372
OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. ANONYMOUS ATTORNEY, Respondent.
No. 449 Disciplinary Docket No. 3.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Sept. 27, 2000.
